translated: The Tārā-rahasya, of which this is a commentary, was written in Bengali by Brahmannanda in Śaka era 1100, i.e. CE 1178. It deals with the worship of the goddess Tārā, who is considered to be a form of Kālī. Although originally a Buddhist goddess, this manuscript of the Tārā-rahasya-vṛtti appears to be a separate version of the Tārā-rahasya-vṛttikā by Gauḍīya Bengali Saṅkarācārya, which is already available among the texts of Muktabodha. Although the identity of the two texts is discernible, the differences are substantial enough to warrant separate consideration and comparison of the two.

analyzed: revision
translated: The Tārā-rahasya, of which this is a commentary, was written in Bengali by Brahmannanda in Śaka era 1100, i.e. CE 1178. It deals with the worship of the goddess Tārā, who is considered to be a form of Kālī. Although originally a Buddhist goddess, this manuscript of the Tārā-rahasya-vṛtti appears to be a separate version of the Tārā-rahasya-vṛttikā by Gauḍīya Bengali Saṅkarācārya, which is already available among the texts of Muktabodha. Although the identity of the two texts is discernible, the differences are substantial enough to warrant separate consideration and comparison of the two.
